abstract: The chairman of the Federal Reserve told members of Congress he would back tax cuts or spending measures, so long as they are temporary.
snippet: The chairman of the Federal Reserve told members of Congress he would back tax cuts or spending measures, so long as they are temporary.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Ben S. Bernanke, chairman of the Federal Reserve, has told members of Congress that he can support tax cuts or spending measures to stimulate the economy, even if they temporarily increase the budget deficit, as long as the measures are quick and temporary.

headline.main: Bernanke Is Said to Support Stimulus Measures
headline.print_headline: Bernanke Is Saying He Backs Moves to Aid the Economy

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: White House Council of Economic Advisers

byline.original: By Edmund L. Andrews and David M. Herszenhorn
